name: Le Cygne d'Argent

reviews.text: In a quiet backstreet, 10 mins walk from city centre, 15 mins walk from main railway station. Second time we have stayed here and once again found it to be very good value. Helpful, friendly staff. Rooms are on the small side but that's what you'd expect for the price. However, it suited our needs perfectly. There is also covered parking in a garage round the corner for €8/day.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.text: i went there in july 2010, it is not far away from the center. it is moderate but really clean. some of the staff were very unfriendly, only one lady was comprehensive. the room is small but it was fine, everything was repaired...but no air condition. we didn't actually need it cause the weather was good. the breakfast was very simple. and i recommend it just for business matters but not with children at all as it is very boring.
reviews.title: moderate but clean

reviews.text: The hotel is a basic 2-star hotel within walking distance to the train station and city center. The single room was very cramped but fairly clean. Breakfast is not included. Aside from the young oriental man at the front desk, the staff were not that friendly.
reviews.title: basic 2-star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Construction and parking were a nightmare around the hotel. Once found, the hotel was great. Very friendly staff, all spoke English. Easy check-in and check-out. Room was small, but adequate. Great view from room on second floor. Parking garage around corner for E9/day. Locked at night, but there is a key if you need to get your car.
reviews.title: Perfect for quick trip

reviews.text: We stayed there last year, the rooms are clean and reasonable. There was a small lift which occasionally didn't want to work, which would be an issue for those with prams/kids or the less able bodied as the hotel rooms are up several flights of stairs.
reviews.title: Okay, but some problems

description: In a world where rapidity and efficiency prevail, comfort and well-being of our guests are still among our first preoccupations.
